intro: Oreocarya affinis var. perennis, commonly known as the perennial oreocarya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in native plant gardens.
